thread.title: The Walk: Joseph Gordon-Levitt delivers high tension as Philippe Petit
thread.title_full: The Walk: Joseph Gordon-Levitt delivers high tension as Philippe Petit | DailyTelegraph

author: Nick Dent
title: The Walk: Joseph Gordon-Levitt delivers high tension as Philippe Petit
text:
HOW 24-year-old Frenchman Philippe Petit illegally strung a wire between the twin towers of the World Trade Center with the aim of tightrope walking between them was the subject of 2008’s Oscar-winning documentary Man On Wire.
The Hollywood dramatisation The Walk doesn’t capture quite so brilliantly the stranger-than-fiction audaciousness of the feat, nor its death-defying poetry, but comes pretty close.
Joseph Gordon-Levitt plays Petit, who jovially narrates the film from an imaginary perch atop the Statue of Liberty — that French-made symbol of personal freedom and, in 1974, a lady with an enviable view of the newly built towers.
A Paris street performer who gets the idea for his “coup” from a magazine article on what was then the tallest building in the world, Petit rallies to his cause his girlfriend Annie (Charlotte Le Bon), and his circus mentor Papa Rudy (Ben Kingsley), who prophetically warns
him to never walk a wire whose integrity he hasn’t checked himself.
Charlotte Le Bon and Joseph Gordon-Levitt in The Walk. Veteran director Robert Zemeckis is no stranger to tales of extraordinary achievers who may also be fools (Forrest Gump, Flight), nor to the innovative use of special effects (Back To The Future, Who Framed Roger Rabbit, Beowulf).
He’s reconstructed the towers convincingly and shot the film in 3-D, which amplifies the gulp factor when it comes to scenes set 110 storeys up.
 The movie excises any mention of Petit’s Australian warm-up, walking between the north pylons of the Sydney Harbour Bridge (boo!), and paints him as more of an inexperienced underdog.
Also, the lead character’s insistence his French accomplices all speak English for “practice” seems like sheer Hollywood expedience.
But, after a shaky start, the film gradually becomes as taut as a high-tension wire: a complicated heist carried out in the name of wonderment.
And during the dizzying, emotional climax your heart will be in your mouth — if your hands are not in front of your eyes.Opens Thursday.
Joseph Gordon-Levitt as 24-year-old Philippe Petit. THE WALK
Released by Sony Pictures
Star rating 4/5
Director Robert Zemeckis
Starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Ben Kingsley, Charlotte Le Bon
Rating PG
Running time 123 minutes
Verdict Tale of a historic stunt is mostly sure-footed
